message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CY 

Reasoning: 
- cs.CL (Computation and Language): The paper uses a recurrent neural network (RNN) with Gated Recurrent Units (GRU) to predict the business sentiment of a given text. This falls under the scope of natural language processing (NLP) and text classification, which are common topics in the cs.CL category.
- cs.IR (Information Retrieval): The paper applies a one-class support vector machine (SVM) to filter out texts deemed irrelevant to business sentiment. This is a common technique in information retrieval, which is a subfield of CS that deals with the representation, storage, organization, and access to information.
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): The paper uses machine learning techniques such as RNN and SVM to develop a new business sentiment index. This falls under the scope of machine learning, which is a broad subfield of CS that deals with the development of algorithms that can learn from data.
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): The paper uses AI techniques such as RNN and SVM to develop a new business sentiment index. This falls under the scope of AI, which is a subfield of CS that deals with the development of intelligent agents that can perform tasks that typically require human intelligence.
